economy

Class Market

  • java.lang.Object
    • economy.Market

  • public class Market
extends java.lang.Object
    A free market economy in which agents can exchange money and physical goods.
    See Also:
    Agent

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Market()
      Creates a new market with no agents and no items.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addAgent(Agent agent)
      Sets a given agent's market to the current market and, in turn, adds the given agent to this market's list of agents.
      void addAgents(Agent... agents)
      For each agent "agent" passed in: sets "agent"'s market to the current market and, in turn, adds "agent" to this market's list of agents.
      void addAgents(java.util.Collection<Agent> agents)
      For each agent "agent" passed in: sets "agent"'s market to the current market and, in turn, adds "agent" to this market's list of agents.
      void changePrice(Item item, double amount)
      Changes the price of an item in the current market by a given amount.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
      Returns true if and only if the current market is "equal" to the given object.
      void generateAgents(long num)
      Generates a number of agents, all with random name, $0.00 and no items and adds them all to this market.
      void generateItems(long num, long maxQuantity)
      Generates a number of items types, all with random names, and disperses a random quantity of each item type generated randomly among agents in the current market.
      void generateMoney(double amount)
      Generates an amount of money and disperses equally among agents in the current market.
      java.util.List<Agent> getAgents()
      Returns an unmodifiable view of the list of agents in the current market.
      double getAgentWealth(Agent agent)
      Gets an agent's net wealth in the context of the current market.
      Inventory getItems()
      Returns a copy of all items which exist in the current market.
      double getPrice(Item item)
      Returns the current market price of a given item.
      Agent getRandomAgent() 
      long getSupply(Item item)
      Returns the quantity of a given item existing in the current market.
      int hashCode()
      Returns a hashcode for the current market using the current market's agents and prices.
      void removeAgent(Agent agent)
      Sets a given agent's market to null and, in turn, removes the given agent from this market's list of agents.
      void removeAgents(Agent... agents)
      For each agent "agent" passed in: sets "agent"'s market to null and, in turn, removes "agent" from this market's list of agents.
      void removeAgents(java.util.Collection<Agent> agents)
      For each agent "agent" passed in: sets "agent"'s market to null and, in turn, removes "agent" from this market's list of agents.
      void setPrice(Item item, double price)
      Sets the price of a given item in the current market.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the current market of the form: ITEMS: {
        ITEM1, ITEM2, ITEM3, ..., ITEMn
      }
      AGENTS: {
        AGENT1,
        AGENT2,
        AGENT3,
        ...,
        AGENTn
      } where ITEMk denotes the string representation of the kth item in the list of items which exist in the current market and AGENTk denotes the string representation of the kth agent in the list of agents which exist in the current market.

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • generateAgents

        public void generateAgents(long num)
        Generates a number of agents, all with random name, $0.00 and no items and adds them all to this market.
        Parameters:
        num - The number of agents to generate.

      • generateItems

        public void generateItems(long num,
                          long maxQuantity)
        Generates a number of items types, all with random names, and disperses a random quantity of each item type generated randomly among agents in the current market.
        Parameters:
        num - The number of item types to generate.
        maxQuantity - The upper bound (exclusive) on the random quantity of each item type to be dispersed.

      • generateMoney

        public void generateMoney(double amount)
        Generates an amount of money and disperses equally among agents in the current market.
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount of money to generate and disperse.

      • addAgent

        public void addAgent(Agent agent)
        Sets a given agent's market to the current market and, in turn, adds the given agent to this market's list of agents.
        Parameters:
        agent - The agent to add to the current market.

      • addAgents

        public void addAgents(Agent... agents)
        For each agent "agent" passed in: sets "agent"'s market to the current market and, in turn, adds "agent" to this market's list of agents.
        Parameters:
        agents - The agents to add to the current market.

      • addAgents

        Parameters:
        agents - The agents to add to the current market.

      • removeAgent

        public void removeAgent(Agent agent)

        agent - The agent to remove from the current market.

        Parameters:

      • getAgentWealth

        public double getAgentWealth(Agent agent)
        Gets an agent's net wealth in the context of the current market.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the current market of the form:
        ITEMS: {
          ITEM1, ITEM2, ITEM3, ..., ITEMn
        }
        AGENTS: {
          AGENT1,
          AGENT2,
          AGENT3,
          ...,
          AGENTn
        }
        where ITEMk denotes the string representation of the kth item in the list of items which exist in the current market and AGENTk denotes the string representation of the kth agent in the list of agents which exist in the current market.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The string representation of the current market.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Returns true if and only if the current market is "equal" to the given object. That is,
        • The given object is of type Market,
        • The given other market has agents equal to the current market's agents.
        • The given other market has prices equal to the current market's prices.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - The other object to test equality against this market.
        Returns:
        True if this market is equal to the other object; false otherwise.

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hashcode for the current market using the current market's agents and prices.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A hashcode for the current market using the current market's agents and prices.
